The article mentions a significant amount of money that was allegedly used to influence the 2008 election. If the estimated cost to influence the election is three billion dollars, how many million dollars is that? 
(Hint: Remember that one billion is equal to one thousand million.)

To convert billion dollars to million dollars, you multiply by 1,000 since one billion is equal to one thousand million. Therefore, if the estimated cost to influence the election is three billion dollars, it would be:

\[ 3 \text{ billion dollars} \times 1,000 = 3,000 \text{ million dollars} \]

So, three billion dollars is equal to 3,000 million dollars.
